intro: Pycnostachys affinis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and produces flowers in shades of violet, pink, and white. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
